vsParam:
Ah, it's Bergamot Sensei!
It seems that she's looking at something...

Sensei, what are you looking at?
Is it a newly discovered alchemical recipe?

Ah, you guys. This is the... notebook of a senpai
in the special training of alchemy.

I found it while cleaning the table.
It reminds me of the past.

Special training of alchemy?
Sounds so awesome!

[px]... If you want it, I'll give it to you.
It should be able to help you.
Is it... too hard for me?

That's a resolute answer.
Only this attitude would worth this notebook.

It depends on your capability now.
Please take it seriously.

Look at the first item, collecting materials.
The contents are all in this chart.

Uh? T, that's it?
Seems pretty easy...

Yeah. When you finish this,
I'll tell you why I give you this assignment.

Um, I still think this is way too easy,
although I don't think Bergamot Sensei is making a joke...
Good. Looks like you have finished the assignment.

Uh huh,
this is just a walk to the park!

Might as well say that it's too easy,
and makes me anxious...
Sensei, is this really a special training program?
Yeah, it is. It can't be wrong.

The senpai who designed this special training
was a gentle and honest person who was confident in the future.

But that senpai
always say "I lack talent".

To make up for her lack of talent, she made unremitting
efforts. And at the same time...

No matter how great she gets, she never forget to
strengthen her basic skills and theoretical foundation.

I never seen anyone as devoted to
alchemy as her.

Exactly. This is a special training program which
strengthens basic skills by revision and reflection.
That's someone you respect very much, right?

Yeah... Although it's kind of embarrassing to say it...
I dreamed many times of becoming an alchemist like her.

Yeah, perhaps.
It's very precious as I can never go back to those days...

Today's special training may be dull, but you'll develop the
ability to identify materials after repeated trainings.

You can't truly master knowledge by reading books alone.
Some skills can only be acquired by experience.

So, don't forget about today's special training
and remember to train by yourself.

Let's call it a day.
We'll continue in the next special training.
